label: Letter from Gertrude Sanford Legendre, January 31, 1944
description: Letter from Gertrude Legendre to her husband, Sidney Legendre, discussing a weekend she spent in the city reading, going for walks, and dodging the buzz bomb raids.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Letter from Gertrude Legendre to her husband, Sidney Legendre, discussing a weekend she spent in the city reading, going for walks, and dodging the buzz bomb raids.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
Lt. Sidney J.Legendre U.S.N.R.
P.O.166
Navy No 128
Commandant
Fleet Post Office
SanFransisco, Cal.
Gertrude S.Legendre
O.S.S.Detachment
A.P.O.887
PostmasterNew York
R 2 17 44 Jan 31st '44
Dear Sidney,
Monday morning again. Instead of being able to say I
played golf, went swimming, or sunbathed- I report that I took a
walk in a very crouded park with Ben and watched doodles scurry about
on the grass. It was muddy, mild and quite pleasant,and I was
furious not to be in the country golfing. All my pals had gone off
shooting for the week and and I was not in on it. I saw a dull movie
in the afternoon which was much too long and went early to bed.
Saturday while reading"So Little Time"- an excellent
book you would love, and listeneing to the radio the windows started
to rattle and I got quite a kick out of it. No doubt the papers 
reported terrific doings as they always do in the states, but I
assure you they exaggerateterribly. I lay in bed, never moved a muscle
went on reading, and quite enjoyed the feel of the thing. Sonidering
you read about it in the papers I dont see why I cant talk about it -
but there it is- you cant. Windows are rattling thes[e] days in quite
a few alces over the world,so I dont see how the enemy can know
what place I am talking about. Maybe thiswill all be censored and
you will never get it, [I] dont know.
I had a letter from Ellen this morning telling me she
has gone to P.B. for the winter and was so thrilled to be down there
in the warm and the sunshine. She is becomming a nurse's Aid.
Johnnie S. got back from a quick trip the other day and had a
beautiful time quail shooting in Tallahassee .He was full of
enthusiasm about his trip.Had seen masses of people and had a grand
break. 
I got so many V mail form you all on one day I shall
probably not get anymore for ages.
Lots of love to you, and take an extra duck underthat
blue pacific water for me. I envy you so much.
So long darling, I have little news, but I love you
so much., and miss you terribly.
I am going to a Foxcroft Reunion tomorrow which sounds
pretty funny does n't it? but there are quite a lot of girls here[,]
and as tomorrow is Miss Charlotte's birthday- we are having a
lunch, about twelve of us I think.
Lots of love-
Gertrude Legendre
